description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Zadar" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Zadar

places.generalDescription: Saint Donatus‚Äô Church is a large Catholic church with a circular shape that was constructed in the 9th century. It is located near the Roman Forum and St. Anastasia's Cathedral in Zadar, Croatia. The church has a pre-Romanesque style and is considered one of the most important landmarks in Dalmatia from that time period. Named after Bishop Donat, it features clean lines, a circular ground plan, and fortress-like architecture.

sources.snippet: St. Donatus Church is widely considered to be one of the finest examples of Byzantine church architecture in Europe. The church‚Äôs rounded interior allows filtering light to create patterns at different times of the day. The church‚Äôs exterior flaunts impressive architecture.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Places To Visit In Zadar
Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Church of St. Donatus

reviews.text:
A beautiful ancient church located in the heart of Zadar's old town and near the sea front. Taking a walk around old town reveals its historic charm, with each alleyway having its own story to tell!
A walk around the oldtown and the sea front is definitely a must in Zadar!

An impressive ancient church located next to the Forum and the Cathedral. We were visiting early and had the place to ourselves. It was probably built in the 9th century and its design reflects architectural traditions of that time. It has a very authentic and somewhat eery vibe. I wish there were more explanations or some sort of a tour, but anyway, it was an interesting stop in Zadar. The entrance was 4 ears (cash only).

Ancient church, surrounded by roman heritage of an old town square and amphitheater. The church is small but still neat to see and sit and imagine how assemblies were held inside. Beautiful steps, and clean. 5‚Ç¨ per son's over 10yrs old to enter. About a 30 min adventure at most. But you can't put a price on history

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the stunning coastline of Zadar, the Sea Organ is a remarkable fusion of art and nature that captivates visitors with its enchanting melodies. This large experimental musical instrument is ingeniously designed beneath a staircase leading to the sea, where waves interact with a hidden system of pipes and whistles. As the tides ebb and flow, they create hauntingly beautiful sounds that are both unpredictable and mesmerizing.

sources.snippet: The sunset itself is something else, and many (famous) people have already taken notice, but if witnessed by the Sea Organ and the Greetings to the Sun, your eyes and ears will have a particular treat. The Sea Organ plays always original music when the waves hit the pipes underneath the promenade steps, while the Greetings to the Sun is a light installation that entirely justifies its name - a unique display of colours happens as the sun sets.
sources.shortName: Discover Romance in Zadar - Boutique Hostel Forum

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a more active stay, there‚Äôs plenty of options available, none more lively than kayaking tours along the coastline. Both half-day and full-day trips allow you to paddle the region, discovering secluded coves, rugged cliffs and untouched beaches nestled by the Adriatic Sea. With experienced guides leading the way, you can relax and take in the natural beauty of Dalmatia, focused on creating unforgettable memories together.
sources.shortName: Zadar for couples

sources.snippet: From the mesmerizing melodies of the Sea Organ to the breathtaking beauty of Sakarun Beach, Zadar offers an array of enthralling attractions that'll ignite the spark in your relationship. Join us as we unveil the top 10 must-visit spots for lovebirds in this charming coastal haven, and uncover why Zadar is the ultimate destination for your next amorous adventure.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places for Couples in Zadar

sources.snippet: Right next to The Greeting to the Sun, you will find another modern wonder: Sea Organ. Although they may look like ordinary steps, they are actually a wonderful blend of architecture and music. Because of their shape, you can also sit on them, so they have became a gathering place for tourists and locals.
sources.shortName: 13 Things to Add to Your Zadar, Croatia Itinerary

sources.snippet: Also on Zadar's southwestern quay, the celebrated Sea Organ is an urban installation and a musical instrument. Tubing within the stone steps transforms the movement of the waves and the sea breezes into a series of haunting chords. It makes the perfect accompaniment to the sunset.
sources.shortName: 22 Things to Do in Zadar

sources.snippet: As the waves ebb and flow they push air through the 35 underwater pipes that stretch across 70m. The enchanting harmonious musical sounds can be heard all the way along the Riva promenade. The Sea Organ is the creation of Croatian architect Nikola Ba≈°iƒáis.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Places To Visit In Zadar
Romantic Sunset Sailing Trip in Zadar
Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Sea Organ

reviews.text:
It's one of the most unique and peaceful places I've ever visited. The sound of the waves creating soft, natural music is so relaxing - perfect for just sitting back and enjoying the moment.

The sunset here is breathtaking - the sky turns into a mix of orange, pink, and purple while you listen to the ocean "play" its song. The atmosphere is calm, romantic, and ideal for unwinding after a day of sightseeing.

A beautiful blend of nature, art, and sound. Don't miss it if you're in Zadar!

This was one of the most unique and mesmerizing public art installations I've ever experienced. It looks like a giant glass disc set into the promenade, but as the sun sets, the entire thing comes alive with vibrant, shifting lights powered by solar energy collected during the day.

The best part? You're watching this incredible light show right next to the Adriatic, with live waves crashing and the Sea Organ playing in the background. Magical. The atmosphere in the evening is peaceful yet energetic-locals and travelers just soaking in the vibe.

A must-visit if you're in Zadar, especially at sunset.

If you are in Zadar, you must visit the Sea Organ! It's a peaceful and unique place where you can relax and listen to the music created by the waves. The sound is calming, and the view of the sea is breathtaking. A perfect spot for sunset! üåä

places.address: Obala kralja Petra Kre≈°imira IV, 23000, Zadar, Croatia

places.generalDescription: The Five Wells Square, located near the Land gate, is a historic public square dating back to the 16th century. It is renowned for its five ornate stone wells that were part of a water supply system designed by the Venetians. The square is surrounded by medieval structures, including the Captain's tower embedded in the city walls. Visitors can climb to the top of this tower for a panoramic view of the Old Town.

sources.snippet: According to the official website of Zadar‚Äôs tourist board, the Five Wells Square was built all the way back in 1574 during the siege of the army of the Ottoman Empire so the people of Zadar would have access to fresh water. After the danger from the Ottomans had passed, a protective wall was built around the square. Today, this is a popular tourist sight and, in a way, a gastronomic destination, because close to the square, you can find a few quality restaurants.
sources.shortName: 13 Things to Add to Your Zadar, Croatia Itinerary

sources.snippet: Just a short walk from Zadar Cathedral, you'll find the charming Five Wells Square, a historic gem that's perfect for a romantic stroll with your loved one. Officially known as Trg Pet bunara, this picturesque square dates back to the 16th century when the five large wells were constructed to provide water to the city during Venetian rule. Today, the square has been beautifully restored, offering a glimpse into Zadar's rich past.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places for Couples in Zadar

places.name: The Five Wells Square

reviews.text: This is a fantastic square with the five wells that used to supply water to the whole of Zadar and plenty of places to eat and drink. Take the steps behind the wells to look down on the land gate entrance to the old town.

Attractive town square with 5 hexagonal well heads. Also a large tower to rear with a gallery but it was shut on a Saturday in September. Maybe nicer at night to seat with a drink. The park behind square was a nice spot too.

One of the hot spots to visit in Zadar.

Some beautiful buildings to see.

Plenty of ice cream shops and bars and restaurants to check out.

The alleyways from the site are great to see.

The church is very beautiful place also.

places.generalDescription: L'Osteria 12 Restaurant & Bar is a highly recommended dining spot in Zadar old town, offering a diverse menu to cater to various tastes. The restaurant stands out not only for its excellent food but also for its exceptional service, creating a memorable dining experience. Visitors praise the relaxing ambiance and attentive staff, particularly highlighting the friendly and knowledgeable waiter who added to their enjoyment.

sources.snippet: L‚ÄôOsteria 12 is celebrated for its exquisite pasta dishes and perfectly cooked seafood. The ambiance is ideal for a romantic evening.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: L'Osteria 12 Restaurant & Bar

reviews.text: We chose this restaurant based on the reviews. It's a small restaurant and we had to wait for about 15min to get seated, but it was worth it. The service was excellent. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the food. I mentioned to him that my friend is pregnant and he was fully aware of what pregnant women can eat and warned us that the desert/ tiramisu has raw eggs. He was lovely. The food was very good. We had a lovely time üëåWe ordered bruschetta with meat as a starter. Tuna steak, Seafood pasta. They were serving Tiramisu as dessert. So nice. Small glass of wine, Miranda and 2 large bottles of wine. The bill came up to 80‚Ç¨ which was worth it. Portions were great. we couldn't finish the mains as we wanted to keep room for the dessert and we got the rest of the food to go.

Nice address in the old city of Zadar. No reservation is possible, you wait inside the lobby of one building, it was fast we went around 7:30pm but when we left the queue was super long. The menu offers italien meals with local products and pasta are very good.  The waitress is very professional and polite and he took care of all requests during the dinner with the smile. Thank you for this nice meal and time in your restaurant.

Best restaurant in Zadar!  Salmon (pictured) and sea bream were perfectly cooked.  Mussels in light broth were delicious, I nearly drank the broth.  Wine recommendations were spot on.  The waiter was friendly and helpful and spoke English. Excellent experience overall.  We sat outside in a courtyard away from the walkway traffic.  We enjoyed a late lunch/early dinner around 4pm.

places.generalDescription: Kolovare Beach is a popular coastal spot in Zadar, Croatia, offering crystal clear waters for swimming and sunbathing. It's conveniently located near the Old Town, just a short walk away. The beach features a mix of sand and pebbles, with shaded green areas for picnics and relaxation. Visitors can enjoy amenities such as showers, changing rooms, and toilets. Additionally, the beach is surrounded by a pine forest that provides shade during hot summer days.

sources.snippet: End your day with a relaxing stroll along Kolovare Beach or enjoy a candle-lit dinner at one of Zadar‚Äôs romantic restaurants.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Kolovare Beach

reviews.text:
Fantastic spot to swim at, I was surprised that everyone was behaving since not everyone does that in Sweden. There were so many nationalities, yet it felt safe. There weren't any loud music, no hookahs etc, you understand why I am talking about.

I'd recommend coming with swimming goggles. The water is clear and you can spot individual fishes and sometimes a school of fish underwater. Very pretty ‚ù§Ô∏è.

Only natural beaches equipped with showers. No private beach where you can rent a space having deck chair and umbrella to have shade all the time to spend the whole day. The water quality and views are excellent but not enough to have maximum pleasure. But in high season like in July you hardly can find a free spot at the beach. This is the biggest problem makes the beach time only good for a few hours not whole day.

Oh my goodness, the Adriatic sea at this beach is crystal clear and the temperature of the water was so pleasant I could have swam all day. I set my towel under a huge tree to shelter from the blistering sun, and to be near the ladder to the sea. I was lying on packed earth, there is a lovely concert walkway right beside the sea, but no shelter there from the sun. My point being, the packed earth was revoltingly covered in cigarette butts, I've never in my life seen so many in one place. More bins definitely need to be provided, but  until that happens, bring your rubbish away with you cigarette butts are definitely rubbish, put them in a bottle or something until you are leaving and bring them with you. The famous crystal clear waters of the Adriatic won't be clean for long with the bad attitude of beach users.

places.generalDescription: The Greeting to the Sun is a modern artistic installation located in Zadar, consisting of 300 multi-layered glass plates arranged in a circle on the waterfront. Beneath these glass plates are solar modules that create a symbolic connection with nature through light. At sunset, the lighting elements within the circle illuminate and produce a mesmerizing light show synchronized with the waves and sounds of the nearby Sea Organs.

sources.snippet: Greeting To The Sun is a solar-powered work of modern art by Nikola Ba≈°iƒá that explodes into a kaleidoscope of brightly coloured lights, as you walk or dance across its glass surface. The installation consists of 300 multi-layer circular glass plates arranged in the form of an amphitheatre, with a presentation of solar system planets and their orbits.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Places To Visit In Zadar

sources.snippet: Just a few steps away, you'll also find the Greeting to the Sun, a stunning light installation that complements the Sea Organ's music with a captivating display of colorful lights.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Places for Couples in Zadar

places.name: The Greeting to the Sun

reviews.text:
This piece surprised me not just visually but conceptually. It's more than just lights-it's a clever tribute to nature, astronomy, and renewable energy. The solar panels absorb sunlight all day and then use that stored energy to create a multi-colored light show after dark.

It's especially meaningful if you're into science, sustainability, or just interactive public art. Families, couples, solo travelers-everyone seemed to be drawn in. I loved the blend of technology, nature, and creativity.

Great spot to relax, reflect, or just be present.

Greeting to the Sun in Zadar offers an absolutely mesmerizing experience that perfectly encapsulates the beauty of the Adriatic. As the day draws to a close, the sunset here is nothing short of spectacular, painting the sky with vibrant hues that reflect off the calm waters. You'll find yourself captivated by the silhouette of boats gently bobbing on the sea, adding to the picturesque scene. The magic truly comes alive as dusk settles in, and the Sea Organ begins its melodic performance, creating an ethereal soundtrack that perfectly complements the visual spectacle. And then there are the lights of the Greeting to the Sun itself ‚Äì their simplicity is their genius, creating an interactive and enchanting display of the ground that is both playful and profound. It's a place where natural beauty, human ingenuity, and a sense of wonder seamlessly blend together. A must-visit for anyone in Zadar!

Visiting the Greeting to the Sun was one of the highlights of my trip to Zadar. This stunning installation, located right by the sea next to the famous Sea Organ, is an incredible blend of art, science, and nature. During the day, the large circular platform quietly absorbs sunlight, but as soon as the sun sets, it lights up with vibrant, colorful patterns powered by solar energy. It feels like the ground itself is alive with energy!

What I loved most was how the installation connects you to the cosmos - with a solar calendar engraved on the ring and smaller discs representing the planets nearby. It's not just beautiful but also educational. The nearby Sea Organ adds a magical soundtrack as the waves create peaceful, melodic sounds, making the whole experience truly multi-sensory.

The location is perfect for an evening stroll along the waterfront, watching the sunset while enjoying this unique light show. Best of all, it's completely free and open at all times. I highly recommend visiting just before dusk to catch the full effect. A perfect spot for photos, relaxation, and soaking in Zadar's creative spirit!

places.generalDescription: Sandy pocket in a cove backed by backed by a promenade, al fresco restaurants & playgrounds.

sources.snippet: Apart from the royal favorite Queen‚Äôs Beach, discover almost 8 km of breathtaking sandy beaches such as Zdrijac Beach, Bilotinjak Beach or Zaton Holiday Resort Beach, where you can enjoy various activities like volleyball, mini golf, windsurfing, kite-boarding or sea kayaking.
sources.siteName: Romeo and Juliet | Tourist & Travel agency
sources.shortName: Nin ‚Äì one of the most romantic destinations in Croatia

places.name: Zaton Holiday Resort Beach

reviews.text:
The resort is really nice for a family with kids. A lot of options for kids,  not too deep sea ( a little rocks in the sand), 9 pools (2 huge  sections for kids), rollercoaster and other activities, some activities during the day at the pool and at the evening also activities for kids. The umbrella and sunloungers are 7 euros per one, so it's 28 euros per day for one umbrella and 3 sunloungers. At the pool is the same. Half border is really nice options, only breakfast and dinner, no options to choose lunch, food was good, Ice cream shops everywhere, 2.5 euros per scoop,  bread store, fruit and vegetables store (really good one) about 5 restaurants around (not included in price) some gift stores. They do not provide beach towels. Mobile home is really tiny, but everything that you need, 2 units of conditioner. Everything is closed after 10-11pm. Nothing to do for adults after dinner. Kids everywhere.
Horse riding, Jetskies, banana bout, some other water activities, and excursion not cheap.

So much to do on Site. Would highly recommend bike or electric scooter hire as the site is enormous.
On site you can find, Horse riding, watersports, bars, restaurants, funfair, entertainment, swimming pools, beach, shops, excursions (boat trip to Silba is a MUST).

Zaton Holiday Resort is a large complex with well-developed infrastructure, offering a wide range of activities for families with children. Evening events and animations are well-organized and definitely one of the highlights. The resort has shops, restaurants, and fairly well-maintained, spacious beaches. It's also a convenient base for exploring the surrounding area.

Unfortunately, when it comes to the quality of accommodation and some facilities, the resort falls short ‚Äì especially compared to similarly priced resorts in Istria. The mobile home we rented directly from the campsite was in poor condition: a damaged terrace, lack of cleanliness, insects, cobwebs, missing basic equipment (no dishwasher, not enough cutlery), and the air conditioning didn't work for two days.

The biggest disappointment, however, was the pool area. The pools were only open for 8 hours a day ‚Äì from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM. You were not allowed to bring your own accessories such as floats, strollers, umbrellas, or children's sun tents. The entire area around the pool was taken up by sun loungers, which could only be used for an extra fee ‚Äì ‚Ç¨28, regardless of whether you stayed for the whole day or just a few hours. There was absolutely no shade, which made staying at the pool uncomfortable unless you paid. Additionally, the jacuzzi-style pools ‚Äì where bubbles or massage jets were supposed to work ‚Äì were either not functioning or worked only occasionally.

In summary, Zaton Holiday Resort has potential and offers many activities, but it falls short when it comes to comfort and value for money. If you're considering staying here, it's worth checking the specific accommodation and conditions in detail, especially if you're expecting higher standards.

places.generalDescription: Providur restaurant & wine bar is a delightful dining spot located near the 5 wells square. The open kitchen allows guests to catch a glimpse of the young chef and staff who deliver high-quality, delicious dishes with beautiful presentation. Visitors rave about the tasty pasta from the daily menu and recommend trying out the ravioli filled with spinach and ricotta in shrimp and truffle sauce. The warm and welcoming staff provide excellent service, offering great recommendations for both food and wine selections.

sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Providur restaurant & wine bar

reviews.text: We had an early evening dinner. We're weren't super hungry as well as done normally eat pizza but really fancied one. This one (mortadella / pesto / pistachio) did not disappoint. Super tasty! Dalmatian platter for starter and a salad for the side. All spot on. Warm bread and Croatian house white wine which we love. Service was great as well. Requested the terrace upon booking which has a great view.

I'd booked a table for lunch (holiday weekend in May) and when we arrived we were taken to our table straight away. The fish and greek salad were lovely and the service was good. We had a great table upstairs and we could people watch as well.

The service was good. The beef appetizer was great and so was their homemade bread. We did not enjoy the rest of out food though. The greek salad had tasteless vegetables. Tried the shrimp ravioli and the chickpea chicken and while I did not like them, I do not think they were prepared badly, it was just about what I prefer. I also went on a chilly May night so there wasn't much of an atmosphere.

places.generalDescription: Opera Club Zadar is a popular spot for those looking to dance the night away to amazing DJ sets. While there may be a cover charge on most nights, the strong drinks and lively dance floor make it worth it. The club mainly plays Balkan music, creating an authentic local experience. With a mix of hits and new songs, this vibrant venue offers a great clubbing experience with friendly staff and interesting prices.

sources.snippet: More popular options include The Yachting Club, Teatro Bar, The Garden, Arsenal or Opera Club and plenty more, each brimming with scope, atmosphere, music, food and drink options. If you're looking for a truly memorable evening, head to A'mare Restaurant, established foremost as a vibrant hub where guests and locals come together to share experiences. Settle into the night with lush dinner options, featuring exquisite food, an intimate and laid-back atmosphere complimented by live music.
sources.shortName: Zadar for couples

places.name: Opera Club Zadar

reviews.text: One of the best clubs I've been to. Bartenders were awesome atmosphere was awesome. Had the time of our lives. Was relatively safe, and they played a lot of American music, which was nice.

It's not a bad club, the staff was nice, but if you are a Latin foreigner I would skip it, all the music was tiktok/white music. Another thing to consider is that almost 80% of the people were under 18 and they were pretty childish and didn't consider another people's space.
Beer is like 5 euros which is pretty normal for a club.

Can't recommend it for tourists.

I didn't experience any racism or similar, but the place is simply shabby. A lot of "kids", cheap alcohol and not a good vibe. I think there are much better places in the city. If you come, better after 12 am, before that it is empty.

places.generalDescription: In Zadar, Croatia, Arsenal is a popular spot offering a variety of experiences. A'mare Restaurant provides a vibrant atmosphere for guests and locals to enjoy exquisite food and live music. Housed in an 18th-century building, Arsenal wine bar offers an extensive selection of Croatian and international wines in an enchanting setting with knowledgeable staff to guide you through the impressive wine list.

sources.snippet: More popular options include The Yachting Club, Teatro Bar, The Garden, Arsenal or Opera Club and plenty more, each brimming with scope, atmosphere, music, food and drink options. If you're looking for a truly memorable evening, head to A'mare Restaurant, established foremost as a vibrant hub where guests and locals come together to share experiences. Settle into the night with lush dinner options, featuring exquisite food, an intimate and laid-back atmosphere complimented by live music.
sources.shortName: Zadar for couples

sources.snippet: The building on 5-Wells Square is very much ancient Zadar but the interior is anything but. Arsenal is now the premier showcase for art expos, fashion shows, screenings, concerts and happenings. It's also a popular spot for weddings, banquets and business events.
sources.shortName: 22 Things to Do in Zadar

places.name: Arsenal Zadar MS

reviews.text: Wonderful venue well suited for concerts and banquets.
Cool music place!
Nice place for me .... for people over 40

places.generalDescription: The Archaeological Museum Zadar, established in 1832, is one of the oldest museums in this part of Europe. It houses a vast collection of over 100,000 artifacts spanning from the prehistoric era to ancient Greek and Roman civilizations, as well as the early Christian period. The museum showcases archaeological material from various ages including Paleolithic, Neolithic, Bronze and Iron Ages, Roman and Byzantine Periods.

sources.snippet: With artifacts dating back to prehistoric, Roman, and medieval periods, this museum provides a deep dive into Croatia‚Äôs rich past.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Archaeological Museum Zadar

reviews.text: Very interesting and well organized and explained, there are many well- preserved items that are absolutely worth seeing, among them statues and inscriptions,  tiles, etc, but especially the quality of some personal  objects on display such as precious jewellery,  pottery, combs etc is unique. It is quite small but a good visit will take at least an hour.

Interesting sculptures only on the first floor! Some of the works are really interesting and well-displayed (it's a pity that they are not protected). The other floors seem to have been added for volume...
In any case, I'm really glad that I visited this museum üëçüèª
Waited in here for a storm to pass over but we enjoyed being able to view some nice artifacts on the ground floor without having to pay.

places.address: Arheolo≈°ki muzej, Trg opatice ƒåike 1, 23000, Zadar, Croatia

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Ancient Glass is a modern museum housed in a historic palace, showcasing over 5000 ancient glass artifacts dating from the 1st century BC to the 5th century AD. Visitors can enjoy glassblowing demonstrations and explore a gift shop. The museum's location in Zadar offers visitors the opportunity to immerse themselves in the city's culinary scene, with a focus on locally sourced ingredients such as truffles, sheep cheese, and Croatian prosciutto.

sources.snippet: Zadar's Museum of Ancient Glass is a delightful showcase for Roman glassware, displaying the largest collection of Roman vials, goblets, cups and flasks outside Italy. In addition, it's an important centre to maintain and develop glassmaking skills. Visitors can watch the glassmakers and glass blowers at work in their workshops Monday to Saturday from 10am to 2pm.
sources.shortName: 22 Things to Do in Zadar

sources.snippet: The Museum of Ancient Glass is another unique place to visit while staying in Zadar. As its namesuggests, it is specialized in glass and it has more than 5,000 glass objects. The museum‚Äôs official website states that these objects originated in different centuries.
sources.shortName: 13 Things to Add to Your Zadar, Croatia Itinerary

sources.snippet: A visit to the Ancient Museum of Glass offers an opportunity to see demonstrations of glassworking techniques, including bead making and glass blowing. The exhibits include ancient glass artefacts dating back to the 1 st century, as well as modern pieces.
sources.shortName: The Top 10 Places To Visit In Zadar

sources.snippet: With artifacts dating back to prehistoric, Roman, and medieval periods, this museum provides a deep dive into Croatia‚Äôs rich past.
sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Museum of Ancient Glass

reviews.text: Amazing museum. I honestly knew nothing about ancient glass making til I went to this museum. Seeing 2000 year old glass objects, put into context is really something. A really interesting surprising place in Split. Strong recommend!

The museum is a big disappointment as there are repetite glass items and no history or storytelling for the local craftmanship behind. All two floors are absolutely similar and you cannot gain any other perspective on this material locally out of its tomb usage.
The cutest thing is the wall drawing between the floors.
I'm quite dissapointed!

Recommend calling ahead if you want to go specifically to see the glass blowing workshop, as although their websites and signage state that it on weekdays 9am-2pm, I arrived around midday on a Wednesday only to be told it wasn't on that day and to come back tomorrow and it would be on 9am-2pm. I arrived the next day at 9 but it still wasn't on and there appeared to be noone around. After asking about it they eventually did a 5 min show for me at 9 30.
I enjoyed this museum but I think they need to be better with communication around this as it is definitely the highlight of the museum.

places.generalDescription: Kornat Restaurant is a classy yet relaxed dining spot located near the ferry port and Q bar in Zadar. The restaurant offers a refined selection of Croatian wines and a modern interior with bright displays of wine bottles. The staff, fluent in English, provides attentive service at the 20 tables. The menu features high-quality ingredients such as truffles used to garnish monkfish and dry porcini mushrooms to flavor the steak.

sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Kornat Restaurant

reviews.text:
Great experience! The restaurant Kornat is very worth visiting if you like beautifuly served food and outstanding service.
Starters
We ordered a seafood cold plate that was served like a little piece of art, very interesting and tasty variety of seafood with small dots of sauces. Also we had a beef carpaccio that was very good prepared.
Mains
We ordered a lobster with homemade tagliatelle and pork medallions. Both of these dishes were outstandingly good.
But for that high quality restaurant the bread was disappointment, stale and dry. We know Croatia is great with bakeries and local pekarna, so we suggest improving the recipe or change the provider of bread, because for that super quality of food the bread should also keep the level.
All in all great restaurant, great experience, perfect service! We definately will come back for more!
Such a beautiful restaurant with an ambiance overlooking the sea. The staff is incredible they really made me feel like royalty especially Anton ( the older gentleman)

The best service in town! Our waiter Lovre was so attentive and polite. He made sure we had everything perfect for our anniversary date, and as the youngest waiter in restaurant he was first class! He perfectly introduced us the menu and presented us everything to feel sooo sooo welcome. The food he recommended was very delicious and well made. Breathtaking restroom was cherry on top! Thank you Lovre for the best service and unforgettable night!

places.generalDescription: Located in Zadar, Croatia, the Zadar Sphinx is an unexpected sight that has been overlooking Maestral Bay for almost a century. This unique attraction is situated near the Lungo Mare restaurant and is part of an elegant villa built by Giovanni Smirich. The sphinx was added later as a tribute to his late wife, Attila Spinede de Catneis. Despite its European location, this sphinx offers a fascinating link to ancient Egypt.

sources.snippet: Shape is the only thing that Zadar‚Äôs sphinx shares with other representations of the mythical creature sometimes depicted as merciless other times as benevolent. Namely, an artist and art historian Giovanni Smirich built a sphinx a hundred years ago in the garden area next to his house, Villa Attilia in Brodarica district in memory of his deceased wife. The replica of the larger Egyptian sphinx has faced neglect and vandalism throughout the years, but it‚Äôs still there as a symbol of everlasting love that overcomes all.
sources.shortName: Discover Romance in Zadar - Boutique Hostel Forum

sources.snippet: When we talk about sphinxes, we usually think about ancient or even present-day Egypt‚Äînot really Europe, or especially not Croatia. And yet, here it is, the Zadar Sphinx. There are still many unanswered questions, but as is stated on the Sphinx‚Äôs official website, it was probably built in 1918 by Giovanni Smirich.
sources.shortName: 13 Things to Add to Your Zadar, Croatia Itinerary

places.name: Sphinx

reviews.text:
This is the best place in Zadar!
We have been here 2 times and we want to say that this is the most delicious place, nice atmosphere, good staff. The food is amazing! Separately, I would like to say thanks to the waiter Oliver, a very pleasant and caring waiter. Everything was at the highest level, our family liked everything, RECOMMEND!

Just amazing place with great vibes, food & service. We got the tuna & beef tartar, along with shopska salad and hamon. Everything was so tasty, fresh and perfectly seasoned. I'll definitely recommend this place to everyone. During our stay in Split, Plitvice lakes & Zadar, that's the best place we had a drink & meal. The service and attention to the smallest details is amazing üòª
Great staff, lovely place to relax.

places.generalDescription: I accidentally stumbled upon Degarra Winery, which was almost empty at the time. I had the opportunity to speak with one of the owners who gladly answered all my questions and even offered a tour of their production facilities. The winery is visually stunning and has a rich history. They offer an exceptional variety of delicious local wines produced on-site. If you're in the area, don't hesitate to make a stop; it's definitely worth it!

sources.shortName: Romantic Things to Do in Zadar: Top Experiences for Couples

places.name: Degarra Winery

reviews.text: Came for the 7 wine tasting menu. All wines delicious, charcuterie board was lovely. The service made our day special, fantastic from start to finish; informative but not overbearing. We left with a bottle of their specialty cherry wine. Must not miss if in zadar.

We visited another winery previously and were not even sure do we even want to stop by another one. I'm so glad we did! We were first guest and a man who was our host was incredibly nice. We had 7 wines tasting and he had great knowledge about wine and we got a story of how two friends started Degarra in the garage, Also we got beautiful smoked meat and cheese and we had lot of fun with our lovely host who gave us his full attention and entertained us. All wine was very good, my favourite was white sparkling wine. We ended up buying few bottles for our friends. We enjoyed a lot, so instead of 20 min, we ended up staying there few hours! Beautiful wine but all experience was very special thanks to our host. I don't get his name unfortunately. All in all, I can highly recommend Degarra.

We had a wonderful afternoon at Degarra Winery and it was only a short taxi ride from our accommodation near Zadar old town. The 5 wines tasting menu was brilliant alongside the cold plate. Everything was locally sourced and the staff were friendly, attentive and very informative. The wines were gorgeous, we bought several bottles to enjoy when we get home. I highly recommend visiting.
